job_title: FBC Staff in Asheville, NC
pros: Some staff are nice and able to form positive relationships until management tells you you shouldn't be friendly with coworkers because it can lead to gossip. On a rare occasion you get to see clients being helped.
cons:
- Unrealistic expectations across all departments
- Only care about productivity and could not care less about clients or staff
- Burnout and turnover is beyond anything I've ever seen
- Favoritism and preferential treatment is rampant
- Management is nonexistent
- HR does nothing with employee concerns
- No supervision or support
- No training
- Rules change daily
- Benefits are mediocre at best
- Pay at most Daymark centers is garbage
- Most toxic environment I've ever worked in
- CEO pressures providers into taking inappropriate admissions because money
- Once saw the CEO have the medical director change his discharge orders
- A lot of staff are highly unqualified or have no experience to be working with the population that they are
- They force people into outpatient group therapy

review_title: Great for new employees in the field

review_title: Read the reviews before taking a job at Daymark.
job_title: Human Services Clinician in Monroe, NC
pros: Awesome and supportive clinicians. I think they are the only reason I stayed as long as I did. Was work from home for several months throughout pandemic, however they did have staff go back to the office now. Supervision is reimbursed if you commit to working their for 3 years. Some of the clients I have met and worked with during my time here have been awesome. I liked very much being able to provide assistance to people in the community.
cons: Pay is awful, ALWAYS understaffed due to high turn over rate, and the work is extremely tough. You are expected to pack as many assessments/see as many clients as possible during the day , all while your phone is ringing off the hook with requests, limited to no breaks in between sessions. You are expected to have paperwork done in a timely manner, and this typically means working through lunch if you are able to take a break at all, working after close, or on your free time in which you will not be compensated for/paid overtime. Management is clearly overloaded. They are there when you need to make a call and express concerns, however they are not there to ever do a check in and see how things are going, give helpful feedback, etc. As an employee at Daymark, you are left in the dark about much of the changes and what is happening until the very last second. I was unable to ever get a straight answer on anything, especially from the HR Department. There is limited training here upon hire, which means you feel stagnant in your skills, which is a problem as majority of the clinicians are provisionally licensed and wanting to learn to be better mental health providers. For a non-profit, they are entirely too focused on making money for the organization, which I am not sure where it does as it is not in the staff's paycheck or the building that is clearly old and falling apart.

job_title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker LCSW in Asheboro, NC
pros: Good management and trainings available for your license
cons: Pay is a little too low

review_title: Good place to begin, but then run away

job_title: Therapist in Winston-Salem, NC

job_title: Clinician in Charlotte, NC

review_title: Work For a Boss, Not a Company
job_title: Mental Health Clinician in North Wilkesboro, NC
pros:
Staff at Wilkes Center were amazing. Loved working there.
Pay was better than other agencies.
Work-life balance at Wilkes Center was great.
Decent benefits, paid holidays, paid supervision and continuing ed.
Eligible for public service loan forgiveness program. 
Hires provisionally licensed clinicians.
cons:
The overall organization is pretty disorganized. Moving between sites was a nightmare.
Tight-fisted with money; clinicians are still not well-paid despite being the main revenue producers.
In certain sites, the push for productivity eclipses ethics and best practices.
HR is distant and inaccessible with poor response times (if they do respond) to questions not filtered through a supervisor. 
Voicing concerns to HR is likely to result in no change, at best.
Poor concern for supervisory staff that bully or abuse power.
Contract for repaying licensure supervision costs serves as a trap to young professionals.
Some sites pile on excessive work/documentation and expect staff to work until it is all done under the umbrella excuse of staff being salaried.

review_title: Inconsistent, lacking in communication, and unprofessional at times
job_title: in Monroe, NC
pros: Easy to get a job, benefits are great (part-time employees get full benefits), great place for entry-level work, most coworkers are friendly and very helpful, and it is a well known organization in NC.
cons: Not much initial training, lack of communication between management and employees, inconsistency due to a lack of standardization of procedures, pay is well below the average for this industry, there aren't many opportunities for employee development, long-standing employees are visibly disgruntled due to burn out, and management is not very reliable at times.

job_title: ACTT Team Lead in North Wilkesboro, NC
pros: Great work family, team morale high. Lots of flexibility and the management seems to care about employees. Flexible hours but crisis call and client needs can call for some demanding days. Good for people just starting for training and licensure support. Company cars, trainings for job and professional growth.
cons: Lots of paperwork that always seems to increase and never be streamlined down. Crisis can sometimes be tough but with a good team that's proactive it's not bad. Pay should be better- lots of turnover possible due to pay limitations

review_title: OUTPATIENT Mental Health/ Substance Abuse Clinic Lead RN
job_title: Clinical Team Lead in Henderson, NC
pros:
Management is very supportive.  Staff and Providers work together as a team to make sure clients are taken care of safely and efficiently.
NextGen Electronic Health System assists staff with timely and efficient documentation.
cons: Daymark  is located in an area ]NC , which is known for increase in crime rate,  therefore, staff assists each other to remain safe at all times.  Vance Center is a very busy Clinic and office space is limited.

review_title: Good way to start your career
job_title: Therapist in Lexington, NC
pros: Daymark provides you with a great start with a good foundation for clinical mental health or substance abuse work.  It gives you a wealth of support and knowledge in the beginning stages of your career.  Great job to begin directly from grad school.
cons: Pay is not too good, but it is community mental health.  Poor supervision at times and poor management.  Due to its contracts with the state, it has a substantial amount of documentation efforts.

review_title: Great for fresh out of college
